column4: I have trouble networking my dapper and edgy boxes. Openssh-server is installed on both, but connecting always ends up with 'no host could be found'. They are both connected to the LAN, one with DHCP and the other with static IP. The error occurs on both ends.
sudo iptable -L shows input forward and output all set to accept?
sudo iptables -L i mean
yes on the edgy...
and on the dapper too.
and your connecting by ipaddress like ssh 192.168.1.3 -l username  ?
I used nautilus
are you wanting ftp or a remote shell or a remote desktop?
remote file browsing
ssh fails with 'no route to host'
and on the other machine with 'network is unreachable'
yes
can you paste the output of ifconfig to a pastebin site?
Umm... lart me :) It's a PEBKAC :)
cable unplugged :) You can easily not notice on 80 meters of connection between them.
hah :)
sorry :) and thanks
regular old ps2 keyboard? maybe just sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
no idea.. sudo sed -i 's/edgy/feisty//' /etc/apt/sources.list; sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get dist-upgrade  should assuming youre on edgy
Yes, I am. The wiki says that method is not very reliable - why would that be?
er youd want to use g there to that i left out so ignore that
of course :)
honestly though i dont know why you wouldnt just edit the sources.list it is dependable ive never really even used the gui update tool
